title: NOAA's Mike Halpert explains the 2018-19 U.S. winter outlook
content:
2 min, 39 sec
Around three-quarters of the United States is more likely to be warmer than average than colder than average this winter according to the 2018-19 winter outlook, and drought is likely to persist or worsen across large areas of the Intermountain West.
Read the NOAA/NWS press release on the U.S. 2018-19 winter outlook.
